revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=WGR826 |revision=V |asin= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=10/07/2004 |fcc_id=PY3WGR826V |pcb_id=P05-6833100 |type=wireless router, analog phone gateway |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Intel XScale |cpu1_model=IXP425 |cpu1_cspeed=266 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Intel |fla1_model= |ram1=32 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI |expansion_minipci_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=MSI MP54G2 (MS-6833) |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT2560 |wi1_chip2_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip2_model=RT2525 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Kendin |sw_model=KS8995XA |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=3 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=ProSLIC VoIP Chip;Silicon Labs;Si3210;;2; |flags=VoIP, block diagram |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|54 Mbps Wireless Router with Phone Adapter}} :[http://kbserver.netgear.com/products/WGR826V.asp Support page] (useless)
"P05-6833100" and "MADE IN TAIWAN" is silkscreened on the wireless module. :The wireless module is a [[MSI MP54G2 (MS-6833)]].
The block diagram states the device uses.. *[[Intel XScale]] IXP425 @266MHz CPU *16MB of ''Intel'' Flash, 32MB of RAM *2x ''[[Silicon Labs]]'' [http://www.silabs.com/products/voice/slic/Pages/Si32xxProSLIC.aspx Si3210] for VoIP use
===PSU=== The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is a '''[[Netgear]]'''-branded :DSA-0151F-12 A (100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.4A -> 12VDC, 1.5A).
